channel.title: [workaround available] i2p no longer works with the latest tor browser
channel.description:
According to the update at https://www.whonix.org/wiki/I2p Update: Accessing i2p's webinterface on 127.0.0.1 using Tor Browser is no longer possible due to a change in Tor Browser by The Tor Project. You could set to transparent torification, but then you would be vulnerable fingerprinting issues. See ticket for more.
and to what I just tried, the config page can't be accessed anymore.
Is setting to transparent torification the only option, and what does it mean? How do we do it? Once it's configured can we turn it back?

item.title: [workaround available] i2p no longer works with the latest tor browser
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
There is now a workaround documented using foxyproxy for some time.
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/I2P#Installing_I2P_inside_Whonix-Workstation_.28I2P_over_Tor.29

@HulaHoop does that still work?

Wondering about the following…

Use a second instance of the Tor Browser, multiple VM Snapshots or multiple Whonix-Workstations.

Would it be correct to add a note…

This is to reduce fingerprinting issues. (Which are documented under Tor Browser, Local Connections.)

?

Read full topic
item.source: [workaround available] i2p no longer works with the latest tor browser

item.title: [workaround available] i2p no longer works with the latest tor browser
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
topic split:

add extra browser configured for i2p Development
(Note: Split by JasonJAyalaP from original Support topic) ( https://forums.whonix.org/t/cant-fix-i2p-no-longer-works-with-the-latest-tor-browser ) I think the way to support (or to use) I2P is to add a simple separate browser, like Firefox (or Iceweasel) It should be configured for I2P proxy settings, any other connection should be blocked (may include internal settings and firewall) and also I2P outproxies should be deleted so the fingerprinting problems will not occur since all connections…

Read full topic
item.source: [workaround available] i2p no longer works with the latest tor browser

item.title: [workaround available] i2p no longer works with the latest tor browser
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
When you use Iceweasel, then https://www.whonix.org/wiki/DoNot#Do_not_confuse_Anonymity_with_Pseudonymity. applies. Risk should be no worse than without Whonix.

When using Tor Browser, the risk is unclear, it needs someone to throughly read, understand and document https://trac.torproject.org/projects/tor/ticket/10419. This might apply to using Iceweasel as well.

Read full topic
item.source: [workaround available] i2p no longer works with the latest tor browser

item.title: [workaround available] i2p no longer works with the latest tor browser
item.dc:creator: Dani
item.description:
That’s unfortunate!

With the risk to be pain in the ass, I’m not sure what exactly we are risking if we do that with the proxy settings.
Our Tor identity can be related to our i2p one or there is more to that?

Read full topic
item.source: [workaround available] i2p no longer works with the latest tor browser

item.title: [workaround available] i2p no longer works with the latest tor browser
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
I don’t think there is much hope for step by step instructions since that change in Tor Browser.

The root of this issue is that i2p developers are not working on and need help solving the following issue:
users can be deanonymized with browser fingerprinting

I think Tails has the same issue:
https://labs.riseup.net/code/issues/6534
https://labs.riseup.net/code/issues/6039
https://labs.riseup.net/code/issues/5362

I don’t think either Tails or Whonix are going to solve this issue as long as i2p developers don’t fix the root of this issue.

Read full topic
item.source: [workaround available] i2p no longer works with the latest tor browser

item.title: [workaround available] i2p no longer works with the latest tor browser
item.dc:creator: Dani
item.description:
Seems that lots of people are struggling with this one and there still isn’t solution.
Tails should have those problems too?

Read full topic

item.source: [workaround available] i2p no longer works with the latest tor browser

item.title: [workaround available] i2p no longer works with the latest tor browser
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Does it mean we don't go through tor if we do that?
Anything started from Whonix-Workstation always goes through Tor.
Dani:

is i2p over tor a no go at the moment?

“At the moment” -> seems rather permanent unless someone contributes by understanding and fixing this issue.

If “no go” applies is difficult to say. You can poke around with Tor Button’s proxy settings or use Iceweasel. Do I recommend it? No. Would be pseudonymous rather than anonymous.

The root of this issue is that i2p developers are not working on and need help solving the following issue:
users can be deanonymized with browser fingerprinting

Read full topic
item.source: [workaround available] i2p no longer works with the latest tor browser

item.description:
I read https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Browser#Change.2FRemove_Proxy_Settings.
but I really don’t understand what I’m doing t here.
Does it mean we don’t go through tor if we do that?

is i2p over tor a no go at the moment?

Read full topic
item.source: [workaround available] i2p no longer works with the latest tor browser

item.title: [workaround available] i2p no longer works with the latest tor browser
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
I don’t think unsafe browser is appropriate vocabulary here.

Dani:

Is setting to transparent torification the only option,

As far as someone (me) shared it’s knowledge, yes.

Dani:

and what does it mean?

The short answer is, don’t do it for security reasons.

The long answer is:
no one documented the real implications in user understandable way yet. Technical details can be found by understanding this ticket:
https://trac.torproject.org/projects/tor/ticket/10419

Dani:

How do we do it?

See https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Browser#Change.2FRemove_Proxy_Settings.

Dani:

Once it’s configured can we turn it back?

Undo what you did at https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Browser#Change.2FRemove_Proxy_Settings.

Read full topic
item.source: [workaround available] i2p no longer works with the latest tor browser

and to what I just tried, the config page can’t be accessed anymore.
